column17:
Was the participant aware of the goal?
1= YES  0 = NO
column18: Transcribe the written answer of each participant's guess  of the study's goal.
Purpose is to see how difficult it could be for someone without the same ability as everyone else to write or draw using no hands.

how people thinking can influence excess saliva. when people pay attention with something with holding a pen in mouth can cause excess saliva, as the experiment going, when I connect the dots, that do not require focus, so the excess saliva does not come a lot, however, when I was looking the cartoon. like I was thinking what does that mean, the excess saliva came out.
To research cheap alternative methods used to assist those who are physically impaired in any way.

I think the purpose of the experiment is to monitor how well people react in these types of situations - where we are asked to compled "easy" tasks and monitor how we adjust and use our brain functions to adapt

To determine difficulty level of using other parts of the body to perform tasks that are done with hands, writing. To see if it effects the decision as to whther or not something is amusing, while focused and concentrating on using the pen properly.
To find other part in human's body that can use to do multiple things
To help develp techniques for people who do not have full use of thier hands, to understand abilities of writing with mouth
How well the brain and limbs coordinate. Our coordinative capacity of hands, eyes and brain degenerate.
[Unclear written response as participant kept pen in mouth while completing this section. It was clear that participant was not aware of true purpose when debriefed]
I think the purpose of this experiment is to understand dexterity of people and how well they are able to use other ways for performing simple tasks.

To identify how hard it would be for a person to control a pen/item with their mouth and how they feel while/after performing the task given. The cartoons may be used to identify if a persons 'amusement' level is increased or decreased when they are told to hold a pen in their and make it doeasn't touch the teeth (concentration diverted to holding pen correctly)

I belive the purpose of this experiment was to better understand psychomotor coordination. By better understanding psychomotor coordination we can help those who use different body parts for daily tasks (i.e. mouth for writing, etc.)

I think that the purpose of this experiment is to see how we can facilitate the life of persons unable to use hands to write and do other activities by finding the best way to hold a pen in their mouths.
Trying to understand how people can complete tasks with body parts that they wouldn't normally use.
The purpose of this experiment is to identify the troubles people endure while/if the are or become impaired and to discover new and cheaper methods for them to live their normal days with ease.
Purpose was to examine fine motor movements using parts of the body you wouldn't normally use

I believe that the purpose of the study was too see how we can perform things that we normally have no problem doing without using our hands. By not being able to use our hands the tasks become more difficult.
Embodied cognition? By holding a pen in your mouth it forces you to smile. This would lead to rating the cartoons more positively compared to a control group?
I think it was to see how people with a disability looks at life differently. It was quite hard to enjoy the cartoons while struggling to keep the pen in my mouth at the right position.
How hard is it for people to use their mouth if they don't have hands. Life does not stop, there is always something to back up.
To see if my accuracy or difficulty writing with the pen increased with seeing amusing cartoons.
Seeing if I can write properly with my mouth. Seeing if other parts of the body can be used to do daily tasks.
To determine how difficult tasks are when one must be cogniscent of the way they are writing/communicating.
According to saw the picture that is better to underline than without pictures. Draw the line is difficult than use hand. (Researcher: ESL student)
To do task in a way we would normally not do but that some people have to.
To study if a normal person's cognition will be different if his motorskill is restricted.
To ascertain abilities of those who are not normally used to performing tasks with alternate body parts apar from one's hands.
Is the ability to perform tasks with parts of our body that we don't use certain things.
Testing hand-mouth coordination. Using a pen to test how accurate the mouth muscles are.
To see how people react to drawing with their mouth?
The purpose of this experiment was to provide insight through the eyes of a disabled individual. Not having hands or feet opens up a new spectrum of phsyical mechanics.
If I was to guess it would be to figure out if difficult task such as holding a pen/marker in your mouth and drawing with it can cause frustration on an individuals face

In my opinion, I think the purpose of this experiment is to find out the outcome of people's reaction on different situation when they are being controlled or distracted. At first, second task it is easy for people to do, but the 3rd task is complicated annoying to do. People get annoyed, then they will easy to make wrong decision in fourth task.
The purpose of this experiment was to test one's ability to using facial parts rather then hands; especially to observe how difficult it can be to do so.
To see how we can use other parts of our body to perform physical + mental tasks.

Understanding disabilities or, new thought, does holding your mouth in a laugh/smile position influence feelings of humor. It seems to be about how holding the pen like a grin or smile makes you more likely to find things amusing/laugh, or smile when your face is already in that position

To deciphr if we can adapt our brain to a new way way of doing things while still bein able to successfully complete simple tasks... will our brain so much time focussing on keeping the pen in the correct position that we are not able to easily complete tasks or enjoy stimuli that we normally would.
It's hard. The purpose is to exam the body function which not used very often
Balance
to understand how disabled people adapt. Because they can't use a part of thier bidy so they have to find another way.
The experiment was to check to see if inhibiting a smile would change how we interpreted the cartoons

Part of the experiment is about performing task in an unusual/uncommon way. There is the feeling of discomfort but we are ask to perform a task that can involve thinking. Maybe the researcher wants to see if we can control our physical motricity while using our cognitive part.
to see if we can use other part of our body (mouth) to do tasks. With that being said; using another part that we don't normally use at all to do certain tasks or everyday activities
Let us do something we do not do oftenly. If we use mouth to write from childhood, we can do that well

The disability makes us unhappy. Even that's funny, but I cannot feel happy at all. In the experiment, I was asked for only using my mouth to hold the pen and teeth even can't touch the pen. That's so difficult to write line or circle in the correct position. After reading cartoons, I still feel unhappy, because I don't have "hands" to help myself. Purpose: Whether we are happy or feel confortable when we do simply things without our hands.
The purpose of this experiment is to see how individuals fair with performing tasks with a part of their body they would not usually use.
To see how using parts of your body for tasks that you wouldnt normally use them for affects other abilities, like understanding cartoons. (I think...)

Understanding how people use musceles to do things they don't normally do. To use data from people writing with their mouths to gain a better understanding of how psychomotor coordination workd in regard to using muscles for things other than what they're normally used for. Also, cartoons about cats.

The purpose of the experiment is to see the difficulty people have while trying to complete the tasks because some people unfortunately have no other choice than to hold the pen in that manner. The camera was used to ensure it was being done properly and potentially the degree of difficulty and stress the individual encounters
Not sure.

The purpose of this experiment is to see how peoples coordinating skills are but not necessarily using the conventional everyday methods. The purpose is to see how others who don't have normal coordination manage to manoeuver.

To see how well we exercise control over our body parts to perform everyday tasks. The purpose of this experiment is to see how well we can use our body parts to complete tasks that we do not normally use for them. In terms of psychology, though this study we can use science to explain what our brain can do when given such task. It could help explain how (as mentioned) some disabled citizens can function. They have to do things differently than abled people, but can can we do what they have to go through successfully.

There are many possible purposes of this experiment. I am not sure what the actual purpose is. As described, it is to test a novel method for doing a task (e.g. using something you wouldn't normally use). But it could be about following instructions, how people react to the comics, etc.

To experience how difficult it is for individuals who are not able to use their hands to communicate, writing, studies, etc. It also helped me to understand the importance of participationwith the research that is being conducted to help others who are not able to use their fingers/hands.
Motor Skills. To understand the connection between motor skills and humour.

To determine motor skills when foucusing holding pen in a certain way. The purpose of this experiment is to determine a persons motor skills, ability to focus on a task while doing another at the same.

I think the purpose of this experiment is to understand and try to create technology for people with disabilities like for those who cannot write with their hands. Develop technogies that will make essential tasks like writing easier.

The easier the question is to answer the less trouble will be encountered when completing each task. Maybe it's to prove that there is a relationship between stress and performance; the more stressed you are the worse you'll perform
The purpose of this experiment may have been to see whether people would understand or feel differently about the cartoons with holding a pen in their mouth during the experiment.
To evaluate difficulty in writing when hands can not be used
How well we balance and write w/ a pen with our teeth. How well our coordination
Testing people's ability to write and maintain proper hold of the pen when they are performing unfamiliar tasks. Also testing if these tasks affect the humor of the comics?

To test how the normal people can control the pen to do things which they usually won't use. The results might be compared with the counterparts from impaired people to see the possibility of developing body skills with parts that ordinary people normally won't use. And if there are some variations in understanding while they using parts that they usually not use.

To test motor skills with body parts that you don't normally use them for. The purpose of this experiment was to test basic motor skills by having the patient follow basic drawing directions with parts of their body they don't normally use for drawing/writing.

I think the purpose of this experiment is to view a normal person's ability to use parts of thier body to perform tasks that they would not normally use compared to some of the disabled/handicapped who have no choice but to use them.
To explore ways that possibly disabled people can use inlikely parts of their bodies to perform tasks. The study is trying to assess the success of using a mouth to write instead of a hand.

I think the purpose of this experiment is what other ways we can write with aside from using our hands, we modify our hands to do things like writing, carrying an object or communicate with other people (sign language). This experiment helps research possible ways we can use different aspects of our bodies that could also help us do other needs.
To find an easier way for people with certain disabilities to write and use a pen.

I think the purpose of this experiment was to study one's ability to complete an everyday task with thecomplex use of a different approach to the task. Also, to study how one's mood is affected by doing this complex task.
I'm not quite sure what the point is, I know it has to do with disabilities and cheaper ways to fix it.

To determine people's ability to multitask by performing everyday actions in a reasonable level of discomfort by using different body parts. It can also bring to light adaptibility as, after a few activities. I became a littrle more accustomed to the penin my mouth. Additionally, holding the pen required smiling which made laughing more likely while looking at cartoons.

I believe the purpose of this experiment is to differentiate the ability of motor control that parients that are used to being imapred versus non-impared patients have when asked to perform tasks that require a controlled imparement.
See if this method could be a cheaper alternative for someone with a disability where they might normally have to use expensive technology to be able to write.

We all know how to write so I think the purpose was to investigate how the brain reacts to doing a simple, experienced task with a different body part thus examining not just a physical impairment but a cognitive one as well.
Test how people's reaction's affect their facial experession. Check if someone's feelings be observed through facial expressions.

The purpose of the study is to use your brain to focus on a body part not normally used for varrious tasks (writing with your mouth). It also gives you a feel for people with disabilities that cannot use their hands. I found this task extremely difficult but it was informative. I think this task was very creative and I can see how it is effective with analyzing psychomotor coordination.

I think that this experiment is designed to explore the difficulties experienced by people who have disabilities that prevent them from being ambidextrous, and possibly, to find mechanisms that will enable them to perform normal activities adequately.
I think the purpose of this experiment is to understand how necessary certain body parts are for everyday tasks and how humans adjust if they don't have these certain body parts.
I think that the purpose of this experiment was to gain a better understanding of the challenges people with disabilities face when it comes to completing everyday tasks such as holding a pen.

To see if individuals who have physical impairments can use their mouth instead of their hands. The purpose of this experiment, as indicated above, is to explore other methods/tools that can be used by someone who is physically impared & has little/no motor skills.

Some people sadly do not have use of their hands, I think the purpose of this experiment was to test a new way for such people to be able to write like a "normal" (for lack of a better word) person. Essentially to make their life easier and its quality higher, in a simple yet crucial way.
To see what its like to preform everyday tasks differently (pen in mouth) like people who have disabilities might have to.
to learn how people adapt to using different parts of their body to complete new tasks
I think that the purpose of this experiment was to see if the way we hold a pen in our mouth (eg. lips or teeth) can influence our mood.

The purpose of this experiment is to determine how easily (or hard) it is for a person to complete a simple task using muscles/coordination skills that have not been developed for that purpose. As well the study/experiment is looking for variation between participants to see if any group of people do it better (the experiment) than another group.
I believe the purpose of this experiment was to study how people complete tasks they would not normally do in order to study psycho motor coordination.

To test if humans are capable of doing everyday tasks (writing) using body parts that they would not normally use. The purpose of this experiment is to test the motor skills of humans... whether they can perform different tasks using different parts of their body that they normally not use.

To test suitability of using your mouth for fine motor skills. Also to tes comprehension and accuracy while having to focus on an unfamiliar task, and while having to suppress urges (building up of saliva in mouth that you can't clear until end of task)
To see if it is possible to do everyday activities (such as writing) without using an esential part of your body (hands).
To learn how people can use a pen with their mouth when they are not used to it. To help develop knew technology fo disabled people who do not have very much motor function.
I think the purpose of this experiment is to determine the level of difficulty some handicap goes through especially those who are unable to use their body part for the original purpose.

To determine motor skills. I believe that the purpose of the experiment was to determine the motor skills of humans, which may lead to advances in technology such as joy sticks or other technolohical aids.
To experience how difficult it is for some in our society who do not have the luxury of bring physically/mentally capable fully with their bodies.
To examine the effects of multi-tasking on concentration. To see if concentrating on holding the pen w our mouths detracts from our ability to think about the tasks
I think the purpose of this experiment was to see the effect of completing task with out use the norm.
To see if humans are capable of completing simply tasks or everyday tasks in an abnormal way i.e. writing with your mouth holding the pen instead of your hand.
To show the average person how difficul it is for some to do basic thing; things the average person would never think could be hard. Also, to put things in perpsective.
To understand how we can use other parts of our body to do certain tasks when the usual body part we use is not usable.
To see if things are still funny when performing a hard task. Or to check for solutions for people using other parts of the body for their daily tasks.

I believe this was to help us see that we take the simplest things for granted. Also, we laugh at having to do this, however there are people that have no choice, they have to write with their mouths. So what seems silly and embarising to us is just life to others.
The purpose of this experiment is to see how well that people would fair when performing various tasks with parts of their body that they would most likely not use when performing the task.

To see how well we use parts of our body that we don't use a lot/ever. The purpose of this experiment is research people's ability to perform various tasks with parts of the body that we do not normally use for such tasks.

To understand the cognitive capacity of someone who is trying to multitask while using the pen in their mouth. I.E. be able to understand jokes or think complex grammar while also focusing on using the pen in their mouth.
I believe it was to show how difficult seemingly small skills (in this case the pen in the mouth) can actually be. Also, to show some funny cartoons.
I think the purpose is to gage how easy/ hard it is to learn to use other body parts to do everyday tasks.
To notice how effective everyday simple tasks are carried out from an individual and and can they do it if they couldn't use their hands or were disabled.

It seems like the purpose of this experiment is to see how normal people can perform various tasks, in this case, writing with a pen in our mouths. Maybe to see how easy or difficult it is to write with ones mouth.

I think the purpose of this experiment was to see if the participant could focus on the instructions and tasks given to them while in a way they have to read and do them with a distraction such as the pen in the mouth and having to write it while trying trying to keep it in position in the person's mouth.
Test the ability of people on how well they can handle using different body parts for everyday activities.
To see whether or not chane ib physical uses of an object influences the mental process of

I think the purpose of this experiment was to how well people use a part of their body that they never use, as well as to see how well they can focus on something (such as reading the comic and understanding them) while they are partially distractec (have the pen in their mouth.
To test how movement of the face affect emotions as well as testing fine motor skills.

The purpose of the experiment is to monitor how people use certain body parts to carry out tasks they wouldn't usually use that body part to do. It could also be to observe how certain body parts are more naturally suited to do certain things.

I think the purpose of the experiment is to understand how people that are physically disabled use everyday objects, such as a pen, to complete simple tasks, such as writing. This experiment shows how people are able to use other parts of their body, for example their mouth, to complete simple tasks. I feel like this experiment is also looking at how difficult it may be for these people to complete daily tasks using other body parts which aren't physically disabled.

The purpose of this experiment is for people to understand how difficult to write for using mouth rather than hands. It is like an experiment for normal people to experience the disabled people's life. Some disabled people lose their hands, so the only part for them to write is mouth. It shows how difficult for them to write use mouth. You can not have beautiful writing and it is also waste time
To see if we could multitask. The purpose of the experiment is to determine if we can multitask in a different way and how well our performances were.
The purpose of this experiment was to see how people are able to coordinate with a pen in their mouth.
The test was to asses the plausibility of performing simple tasks without using the body parts that are usually used for such tasks
Using a body part you would not normally use to complete simple tasks to learn how long it might possibly take for someone's body to get used to it and perform the task well.
To test use of a pen while holding it in your mouth.

To see the various ways an alteration to someone's life can affect them and how to improve this with technology. To discover how humans react to a stimulus or alteration in their life to see how they would adjust to this alteration. Also, to make technology for this purpose and to see how to design the best and most efficient technology for those in need.
To see if humans can do basic things without hands or to see whether we can use are brain to do simple tasks but in a different manner.

To see the ability of people using different body parts to complete a set of tasks. The purpose of the experiment was to see how well I can complete 4 task while holding a pen in my mouth. Also to see how well I can understand what is being ask of me.

To understand if someone would be able to do certain tasks, such as writting, with their mouth. Someone with a disability and is unable to use their amrs may benefit from a study such as this one as they may not want to pay for expensive equipment to to such things for them.
to see if people are still coordinated in their movements when using a part of the body they don't usually use
To show the struggles that people with certain disabilities go through on a daily basis.

Some disabled people, they cannot experience convience. For example, people who lost their hands can only use their mouth or feer to hold something. I believe this experiment is trying to remind us that we should be grateful to our health lives.
I believe that the experiment was conducted to test how people who don't have physical disabilities, like missing limbs, do tasks under conditions that they usually don't have to perform under.
To know the facial acts. To know people's facial acts. mouth acts

I think it is about concentration of another individual. To see if the person who was holding the pen was concentrated on the various tasks or if he/she was concentrated on trying to keep the pen away from his/her teeth and the mouth. It could also be to see if the participant could concentrate on only one or various tasks.
To see a person's ability to do a simple task in a difficult way. To see how hard it would be if a person had to always complete the task in that way.

I think the purpose is to realize the difficulties of not being able to write with your hands. The purpose of this experiment is to realize how difficult it is when you are incapable of using your hands to write. This expeirement will hopefully encourage better equipment when it comes to being incapable to write with your hands.
I think the purpose of this experiment was to see if peoples facial expressions change and if they are still able to concentrate on holding the pen properly while completing a task.
The purpose of the experiment is to make sure people's body can influence people's action. The physic part is very important for people's action.
How emotion influences people's action?
I think the purpose of the experiment was to do simple task but in way that we are not used to.
The purpose of this experiment was to test how we operated with a disability under stress. The purpose was to also see how we would handle a disability.

To determine if I would be successful completing the tasks using my lips to hold the pen. The purpose of the experiment was to determine how successful I would be or how well I will do in the tasks while I had the pen in my mouth instead of being in my hand. Or maybe just to complete the tasks with the pen in my mouth.

To find the most effective way to draw/write with a pen without the use of hands? / Problem solving. By not using hands, research can be done on how people people solve the issue of having to draw without the use of their hands. Facial expressions can be recorded and possibly correlated to different actions or emotions depending on who does what.

To show how people react when faced with a given task that typically would not take much thought or effort except this time they must complete the given task without the ability to use the method that they are used to using.

I think the purpose of this experiment is to evaluate people's abilities in common tasks but using an unusual part of your body to do so. The results of the experiment will help researchers develop technologies for individuals who may have a disability.

To write and do thing with our dominant hand is so natural that we don't really think about it ... and now to try and do things in a way which seem unnatural is interesting in regards to how the brain works and processes new things.
To see whether people can use other body parts to complete motor functions.
To see how well you can control a pen while thinking. To monitor how well a subject can think of the task at hand, while remembering/focusing on something else (holding pen in mouth
The purpose of the experiment is to determine how easily a person can perform tasks using a part of the body not accustomed to such tasks.

To test my hand and eye coordination abilities and skills. In my opinion, I think the purpose of this experiment is to test my hand and eye coordination. How skilled I am at doing tasks by thr notmal and typical way. For example, in this experiment I had to see how a can use a pen to do a task without using typical parts of my body like my hand but also being resourceful of using other parts of my body like my mouth to do the task.

To determin the difficulty of using your mouth to hold a pen to write with. This is to see if there are other ways to write without using your hands and technology for those who are not capable of doing so.
I have no idea about this experiment's purpose.
To test if one is capable to complete tasks with other (less used for the tested skill) body parts.
